text: We will hear arguments next in Number 71-1631, Kusper against Pontikes.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the Court.
Mr. Mitchell, Judge Marovitz who was with you on the merits will disagreed with you on your procedural point here, did he, and agreed with the majority of the District Court?
Yes Mr. Justice.
We’ll resume there after lunch Mr. Mitchell.
Mr. Chief Justice, may it please the Court.
The complaint seems to mention only the alleged right to be free from the invasion of privacy allegedly protected by the First and Fourteenth Amendment, is that right?
I think that -- well they allude to the First and Fourteenth amendment though --
That’s all.
That’s correct.
But you only raised one question on the question presented.
I didn’t understand.
You only raised one question on your question presented and I don’t see there is any point in there.
Well, I think that we have raised this in the section of the brief where we suggest that the --
What about your question presented on page 3 of the jurisdictional statement.
Well I think this is necessarily included in the questions that we presented in the jurisdictional statement and I think that the rules provide --
You keep saying questions but one.
But I think that the jurisdictional questions are questions that were necessarily included in any question that is presented in this Court if there was no jurisdiction.
Well, I submit that in the future, if you have those it would be better if you raised them.
I would take note and do that Mr. Justice Marshall.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the Court.
